text:
Here is the symptom from whom has the same problem I had

=======
I'm using mod_dav with Apache 2 - in a mixed windows and macosx
and linux environment. Files uploaded from Macs also upload
an associated .file  which is often the preview of an image etc.
Sensibly on the mac you don't see these 'hidden files' - you just see the
main files. But windowsXP seems to show all dot files (includeing
.htaccess!) even though these are denied by the server config.
=======

So I solved this problem, the patch will be uploaded soon.
creator: xuphey@gmail.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
It doesn't require a patch.

(Hint:  <Files > is your friend :-)

creator: xuphey@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 16550
diff output of what i changed the code, totally 3 files

1. add following directives in your httpd.conf under direcotry/location
directive which you have Dav On.
    DAVFileFilter: specify regex pattern that matchs the file(s) will not be
shown to the agent in pattern DAVAgentFilter.
    DAVAgentFilter: specify regex pattern that matches the agent will show the
filtered files.
2. restart apache.
 
I used DAVFileFilter to compare with filename that being processed in PROPFIND.
when the condition is meet, this file will not shown in the client that is NOT
DAVAgentFilter.

Created attachment 16551
source files and compiled so

text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> It doesn't require a patch.
> (Hint:  <Files > is your friend :-)

<Files> can hide all dot files from all user agents.
But we need selective file restrictions based on any text pattern in the 
browser user agent string. I don't see how that is possible with just <File>
restrictions?
